div.class: custom_142122 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

div.span: In an effort to heighten our precautionary measures, we are scaling back the number of days that we are delivering meals but we will still be providing breakfast and lunch for each day our students would normally be in school. This means that you will start receiving multiple meals to cover your student for multiple days. Please note the following revised, meal-delivery schedule going into effect immediately:

li.span: Meal delivery Friday April 3rd will provide for April 3rd and Monday, April 6th.
Meal delivery Tuesday April 7th will provide for April 7th - April 9th.

span.strong: No meals provided for April 10th (Good Friday) or April 13th through April 17th (Spring Break).

li.span: Meal delivery April 20th will provide for April 20th only.
Meal Delivery Tuesday April 21st will be for April 21st -April 24 and Monday April 27th.

div.span: Beginning April 21st until school resumes, we will deliver meals once per week (on Tuesday) when school work is also delivered and picked up. Meals will cover Tuesday through the following Monday (excluding Saturday and Sunday). Materials distributed will cover three weeks’ worth of instruction and assignments to be returned as completed, via online submission or on any Tuesday during meal pick up.

span.span: Please, continue to stay informed of this ever-changing situation by clicking on the links below and checking your child’s campus facebook page.
Please contact us at the campus where your child attends school, if we can be of any further assistance!

div.class: custom_131853 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.strong: Education First FCU Pays It Forward to WISD

p.span: Education First Federal Credit Union and its We’re Paying It Forward program distributed funds totaling over $50,000 to 136 local schools in Southeast Texas on Wednesday, January 22, 2020. This program was developed five years ago to support local education while allowing Education First members to direct a portion of their own dollars back into the communities in which they live and work. Since the implementation of this progam they have distributed over $200,000. Thank you for supporting our students!
